Sentencas: The microstructural change in composite of nickel oxide and scandia-stabilized zirconia (NiO-ScSZ) under a reducing atmosphere was observed by scanning electron microscopy (SEM).
Titulo: Morphological evolution of NiO-ScSZ composite in a high-temperature reducing atmosphere

Sentencas: The morphological transformation was noticeable after high-temperature treatment with the formation of two peculiar microstructures; i.e., fibrous zirconia and metallic nickel with wrinkled surface.
Titulo: Morphological evolution of NiO-ScSZ composite in a high-temperature reducing atmosphere

Sentencas: It was suggested that partial reduction of the nickel species dissolved in ScSZ lattice triggered the formation of these characteristic morphologies.
Titulo: Morphological evolution of NiO-ScSZ composite in a high-temperature reducing atmosphere

Sentencas: The growth of fibrous zirconia appeared to be promoted via interfacial reaction between the metallic Ni particles and the zirconia phase.
Titulo: Morphological evolution of NiO-ScSZ composite in a high-temperature reducing atmosphere

Sentencas: The agglomeration of metallic nickel proceeded by the reduction at high temperatures and then the surface was transformed to the wrinkled morphology.
Titulo: Morphological evolution of NiO-ScSZ composite in a high-temperature reducing atmosphere

Sentencas: The unique wrinkled pattern was often observed for the large agglomerated nickel particles.
Titulo: Morphological evolution of NiO-ScSZ composite in a high-temperature reducing atmosphere

Sentencas: This drastic change in Ni-ScSZ microstructure upon the high-temperature reduction degraded the electrochemical performance of solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Morphological evolution of NiO-ScSZ composite in a high-temperature reducing atmosphere
